AddGeneIdSource.description: Represents the source of a sequence that is identified by an AddGene id

id.description: A unique identifier for a thing

input.description: The sequences that are an input to this source. If the source represents external import of a sequence, it's empty.

output.description: Identifier of the sequence that is the output of this source.

output_name.description: Used to specify the name of the output sequence

repository_id.description: The id of the sequence in the repository

sequence_file_url.description: The URL of a sequence file

AddGeneIdSource.title: AddGeneIdSource

AssemblySource.description: Represents the source of a sequence that is an assembly of other sequences

assembly.description: A list of the fragments that are assembled, in order

circular.description: Whether the assembly is circular or not

input.description: The sequences that are an input to this source. If the source represents external import of a sequence, it's empty.

output.description: Identifier of the sequence that is the output of this source.

input.description: The sequences that are an input to this source. If the source represents external import of a sequence, it's empty.

description.description: A description of the cloning strategy

GenomeCoordinatesSource.description: Represents the source of a sequence that is identified by genome coordinates, requested from NCBI

end.description: The ending coordinate (1-based) of the sequence in the sequence accession

gene_id.description: The gene id of the sequence

id.description: A unique identifier for a thing

input.description: The sequences that are an input to this source. If the source represents external import of a sequence, it's empty.

locus_tag.description: The locus tag of the sequence

output.description: Identifier of the sequence that is the output of this source.

output_name.description: Used to specify the name of the output sequence

start.description: The starting coordinate (1-based) of the sequence in the sequence accession

strand.description: The strand of the sequence in the sequence accession, should be 1 or -1

GenomeCoordinatesSource.title: GenomeCoordinatesSource

overhang_crick_3prime.description: Taken from pydna's `dseq::ovhg`An integer describing the length of the crick strand overhang in the 5' of the molecule, or 3' of the crick strand

overhang_watson_3prime.description: The equivalent of `overhang_crick_3prime` but for the watson strand

RestrictionEnzymeDigestionSource.description: Represents the source of a sequence that is a subfragment of another sequence, generated by sequence cutting using restriction enzymes.

id.description: A unique identifier for a thing

input.description: The sequences that are an input to this source. If the source represents external import of a sequence, it's empty.

output.description: Identifier of the sequence that is the output of this source.

output_name.description: Used to specify the name of the output sequence

RestrictionEnzymeDigestionSource.title: RestrictionEnzymeDigestionSource

RestrictionSequenceCut.description: Represents a cut in a DNA sequence that is made by a restriction enzyme

cut_watson.description: The position of the cut in the watson strand. The cut is made before the base at this position (zero-based), so that cut position 1 cuts after the first base.

overhang.description: The length of the overhang that is left after the cut. It can be negative, same meaning as in pydna's `dseq::ovhg` and biopython's `Bio.Restriction.RestrictionType.ovhg`.

RestrictionSequenceCut.title: RestrictionSequenceCut

SequenceCut.description: Represents a cut in a DNA sequence

cut_watson.description: The position of the cut in the watson strand. The cut is made before the base at this position (zero-based), so that cut position 1 cuts after the first base.

overhang.description: The length of the overhang that is left after the cut. It can be negative, same meaning as in pydna's `dseq::ovhg` and biopython's `Bio.Restriction.RestrictionType.ovhg`.

SequenceCut.title: SequenceCut

SequenceCutSource.description: Represents the source of a sequence that is a subfragment of another sequence, generated by sequence cutting.

id.description: A unique identifier for a thing

input.description: The sequences that are an input to this source. If the source represents external import of a sequence, it's empty.

output.description: Identifier of the sequence that is the output of this source.

output_name.description: Used to specify the name of the output sequence

SequenceCutSource.title: SequenceCutSource

SimpleSequenceLocation.description: Represents a location within a sequence, for now support for ranges only

end.description: The ending coordinate (1-based) of the location

start.description: The starting coordinate (1-based) of the location

strand.description: The strand of the location, should be 1 or -1 or null

SimpleSequenceLocation.title: SimpleSequenceLocation

SnapGenePlasmidSource.description: Represents the source of a sequence from the SnapGene plasmid library identified by a SnapGene subpath of https://www.snapgene.com/plasmids/

id.description: A unique identifier for a thing

input.description: The sequences that are an input to this source. If the source represents external import of a sequence, it's empty.

output.description: Identifier of the sequence that is the output of this source.

output_name.description: Used to specify the name of the output sequence

repository_id.description: The subpath of the plasmid in the SnapGene plasmid library. Requesting the plasmid is possible with https://www.snapgene.com/local/fetch.php?set={category_path}&plasmid={plasmid['subpath']} where category_path is the left part of the subpath before the first / and plasmid is the subpath after the /.

SnapGenePlasmidSource.title: SnapGenePlasmidSource

overhang_crick_3prime.description: Taken from pydna's `dseq::ovhg`An integer describing the length of the crick strand overhang in the 5' of the molecule, or 3' of the crick strand

overhang_watson_3prime.description: The equivalent of `overhang_crick_3prime` but for the watson strand

sequence_file_format.description: The format of a sequence file

TextFileSequence.title: TextFileSequence

index_in_file.description: The index of the sequence in the file
